All Reviews

  1. I bought this razor at my daughter's request, and so far she says it's exactly what she had been looking for. Fairly easy to use and seems to hold a charge well. She'll see how it holds up in a few months.
  2. I use this exclusively now! Love it, so easy
  3. Having only one useable hand makes shaving a problem; this shaver does the job - clean underarms!
  4. Works great so far and very easy to clean. Found I do prefer to use it with pre shave oil for my sensitive skin.
  5. Love it. Wish I had bought it much earlier... while it will not give a shave on the legs as close as a razor... its pretty darn close. And for those of us with skin issues and have sensitive skin and can't use razors without a skin reaction, this alternative is great. Highly recommend this product.
  6. never worked as good s my regular razor, but I'm on blood thinners and it is better than nothing.
  7. Absolutely love this razor. Would recommend to any woman I know and have recommended to a few. This is my second one - used the first until battery wouldn't charge anymore (quite a long time).
  8. Best electric shaver I've had. Easy to clean & recharge too.
  9. Great shaver for a nice price!
  10. Excellent product. Easy handling. Clean shave. I'd buy it again!
  11. Have used this product more than once thru the years, this is the first one that blades only stayed sharp about 2 months and it won't hold a charge very long. Probably won't buy this item again
  12. Works great. Would highly recommend.
  13. This is a great electric razor. I have had mine for over a year now and it still works wonderfully! I have extremely sensitive legs so shaving often left me with itchy and burning legs for days. I have had no issues with discomfort while using this razor. It won't get you super smooth legs like you will get with a regular blade-razor, but it will take all the hair off. I love the button that pushes up the blade for longer hairs too. A small issue is that it does spit some of the hair it has shaved back onto your skin, so it makes you think &#34;didn't I already shave this spot?&#34; Lol. And don't use it with damp skin, as it will pull your hair. Your skin either has to be completely wet or completely dry. Also, if it starts to pull your hair, make sure to charge it first. I always charge it after each use so it doesn't pull next time. Definitely glad I bought this razor. The drawbacks are very small compared to the quality you get from it.
  14. I am reviewing this as an electric razor, not a an equivalent of a manual razor. As an electric razor, it gives a very respectable close shave (not as close as a regular razor) and is easy to use. I forget what all the complaints about it are, but I have had it a couple months and I have not had a problem with it not charging properly (you HAVE to make sure it is properly seated in the charger, charger light ON); the charge lasts for at least 2 shaves (I haven't tried to do it longer, I just recharge); it does not damage my skin at all; it is easily cleaned; it is not too loud. I got this because of a temporary skin problem that did not allow for a blade on my skin. The problem is gone and I am still using this.
  15. I don't cut myself, or run out of battery time and it shaves close enough that my legs and under arms are smooth. I love it!

  48. I think I love this shaver. It's only been in my possession for an hour, but it has made me have faith in the virtues of smooth legs again. I sport a decent number of little scars around my knees and ankles from contending with the awkwardness of shaving in THE SMALLEST SHOWER. EVER. I'm not an Amazon, but for whatever reason, trying to get my legs shaved in our rented house's shower is torturous, at best, and downright bloody, at worst. I can deal with the bruises on my elbows from shampooing my hair, but my very being protests when I decide the fur level has gotten out-of-control and I must shave.<br /><br />After a particularly sanguineous round of shaving this last weekend, I decided I must try something less... sharp. I jumped on line and read reviews. Of course, I'd love to purchase the $100 lady shaver whatever, but my budget has been depleted by Band-aid purchases and styptics. This little shaver came up at the top of the list with a decent number of stars and several fairly good reviews. I threw caution to the wind and committed my $16+change to the possibility of a bloodless shave for the first time in nine months.<br /><br />It arrived this morning, nestled cozily with my protein powder and several air-pacs. I unpacked it, read the instructions and then got to work. Although it said it should be charged for 12 hours, it purred to life, so I decided to take it for a test run. I shaved my knees, calves and lower thighs. I tried the little trimmer feature on the more heartily furred part of my thigh that I'd been avoiding while the wounds healed, and it removed the hair readily. While it is not the closest shave in the world, after putting lotion on, I'm pretty darned pleased! It seems to get pretty close and didn't rip or snag the skin. The best thing was the lack of blood trailing down my leg or ankle. I'll revisit this review after a month, but I'm hopeful I'll be even more in love!

The ease of cleaning, comes with two cleaning brushes, is a strong plus. Unless you do a super heavy shaving session, just remove the top and rinse under running water. Comes with a charger and a small bag that fits all gear and the razor, too. Only minor down thing has been catching or pulling on stubborn hairs. This only happened twice, a very brief stumble, didn't hurt, when the razor was just out of the box. No trouble since then.

I suppose that shouldn't come as a surprise, but considering I just sort of randomly picked the first one I saw on amazon that was ~$20, I feel like I got a great deal where I wasn't expecting much. I got this to use in those quick situations where I may need o shave my legs or arm pits at the last minute when I want to throw on a dress or something like that.<br /><br />It did a good, quick job on my legs and arm pits... So I figured I may as well give it a shot on my bikini area. It did a GREAT job there, even though the area was *ahem* a bit unkempt... There are trimming blades on each side to take care of longer hairs and the flat razor part in the center to take everything down to the skin. Everything felt SO smooth and I was wondering what the heck I've been doing cutting myself up with my dollar shave club subscription razors the last couple of years when I could just be using something like this.<br /><br />Overall, it's easy to use, it came charged right out of the box. It's easy to clean, a small brush is included. It's easy to charge using the small plug/dock. It's easy to store in the little fabric pouch that comes with it. It's affordable and feels like a quality product from a brand I trust.<br /><br />I would recommend it to a friend.

  106. So I'll do a comparison on 5 blade venus razor disposable & this electric razor!<br /><br />Venus Disposable 5 Blade: I basically get 1 weeks use out of 1 venus 5 blade cartridge. Which means 1 set of 16 blades at $40 lasts me about 3-4months, meaning I spend $80-120 a year on blades.<br />Panasonic Electric: If it really lasts as long as the manufacture says. I'll replace the foil cover at $7.00 once a year. So $7.00 to maintain this razor. If worst comes to worse I may just buy a whole new shaver ($18.00 here) every year.<br /><br />Venus Disposable 5 Blade: I have to use this with water running in shower to keep my skin warm or I'll get nicks from goosebumps being raised when I'm chilly. So I'm wasting water.<br />Panasonic Electric: I like how this shaves better dry than wet so no water wasted during use. I also can takes this on the go with me.<br /><br />Venus Disposable 5 Blade: I get a really close shave from these! Like no hair left@<br />Panasonic Electric: I get a pretty close shave (comparable to a 3 blade venus razor) Still feels smooth but not as smooth as a 5 blade disposable shave! (this is why I only give it 4 stars<br /><br />Venus Disposable 5 Blade: I nicks and cut myself on occasion and I tend to shave fairly slowly out of fear of slicing into my skin. I have an awful scar from shaving a layer of skin off my ankle area a year ago, YIKES :/<br />Panasonic Electric: I can go as fast as I like, no nicks, cuts, nothing just safe fast shaving!<br /><br />So really if you like being eco friendly and wanna save some money and don't mind if you don't get the closest shave ever just smooth enough to feel nice gliding your legs together. The Panasonic ES2207P wet/dry works great and I don't miss my usual razor. A few relevant facts: I have extremely sensitive skin and very fine hair<br />The run down:<br />(1) gives a close shave quickly and painlessly. The shave is not completely smooth. For me, its the way my legs would feel 12-24 hours after shaving with a razor<br />(2) No razor burn, bumps, or irritated skin. No ingrown hair<br />(3) Works well wet and dry<br />(4) bikini bit works well, though it requires more care than using the shaver normally. I shaved a bit of skin off a finger, but not enough to bleed or anything.<br />(5) shaved well and easily even when the hair was quite long, ~2 weeks of no shaving. Felt great to shave after so long!<br />(6) plugging it in to charge is a little annoying because pressing the shaver in the charger makes the charger loosen a bit from the outlet. No big deal, but a little annoying<br />(7) easy to clean<br />(8) pretty quiet, if you care about noise<br /><br />All in all, I really like this shaver. It allows me a nice fine shave despite sensitive skin and a health concern.

  164. I have had lady shavers in the past and they either left big scratch marks on my legs or way too much stubble after multiple passes. But, this shaver beats them all, even with a dry shave!   165. --edit March 2014--<br />Not even a year old and the motor and battery gave out on it. It doesn't have the power behind it to do the shaving and the battery loses its charge within the hour after having it on the charger for 12+ hours. Major letdown and annoyance.<br /><br />--July 2013--<br />I've had this for a couple of months now and I am very happy with it. Because I'm on a blood thinner I don't want to use blades because of the high risk of cutting myself (and then getting blood all over the place). I've been using electric shavers for a few years now and this one is pretty close to the old Remmington I first owned.<br /><br />I love the nippers on the front AND back. This way I can go up and down my leg instead of just pulling up like a blade. Going backwards is more to catch the strays in my observance. I also love how the front nippers can be raised to shave longer hair first.<br /><br />It's really easy to use and really easy to clean. There's a little brush that is included to clean the blades with. And when it needs it, stick the top under running water and then let it sit on a towel for 12 hours to dry. It fits nicely in hand and is easy to maneuver. I use the razor on it's own without any sort of cream or soap. I find that these razors last much longer this way. Best time to shave is right out of the shower and toweling off. The hair is softer and easier to cut.<br /><br />I also like the charging 'station'. I thought it was a bit weird at first because I'm used to cords and corded charging stands. This though..... it's neat that it gets rid of the annoying and risky cords but, it blocks the outlet. It could just be the shape of the other plugs. I don't leave it plugged in for long. Overnight does a real good job of recharging. I can usually get two shaves before I need to recharge it. Sometimes three. It all depends on how quick I can be.<br /><br />I really recommend this as a replacement for the Remmingtons. I bought another Remmington before this one and it broke down on me within two months. A waste of money. Oh I was ticked.<br /><br />There is another version of this one that has an attachment for bikini lines.

  182. This is an excellent product as far as electric razors go. I had recently purchased a Remington razor for $40. I returned it a few weeks later, as it didn't work very well. Electric shavers don't necessarily get a razor-close shave, but this electric shaver gives a nice close shave. The same day I shave with it, my boyfriend thinks my legs are as smooth as a razor-shave. There is stubble by the next day, but just a few minutes with this shaver makes my legs as good as smooth again.<br /><br />Many people complain about how you have to charge this shaver. I like it much better than the corded razor, it takes up less space and is out of the way when charging. You just have to keep in mind that all you have to do to keep the shaver tightly on the base is to put the shaver on the base first, and then you plug it into the wall. If you do that, the shaver will have no problem staying secure on the charging base.<br /><br />All in all, this is the best electric shaver I've ever owned, I am very impresses with it.

  212. I was given the Panasonic ES2207P for a Christmas gift and I am very pleased. The first time I used it, I wasn't sure if I was doing it correctly or not as it felt like it was burning and wasn't removing the hair. I decided to play with it before making a decision and I realized I wasn't holding it correctly. Cockpit error that's all. Once I realized I wasn't holding it at a 90 degree angle, it was awesome and I am very very happy with it! I found it does do a better job using shaving cream vs dry. You may have to go over a few spots but go slow while using and it'll be a good shave. As long as you hold it correctly (and it even tells you in the instructions) and take your time, you will have a great shave and will enjoy using your new razor! I'm thankful my husband thought to buy this for me as I begun using blood thinners and he was afraid I would cut myself using disposable razors. I haven't cut myself at all with this one! He chose this particular one because of all the other good reviews it got and I am so glad he did!
  213. I AM VERY IMPRESSED! This is my very first lady shaver. I normally use handheld eyebrow trimmers from beauty supply stores to trim facial, underarm and bikini hair. The trimmer will nic and leave cuts in the areas I use. I started on my face and the shaver was very smooth, trouble free and easy to use! I used the pop up bikini attachment and it got to the trouble areas without nics or cuts! I highly recommend this product; it's a time saver and it delivered on what it said it does!! I will write an update soon!
  214. I wouldn't say I am a lazy person but when it comes to shaving my legs, I am the type that doesn't care all that much to be on the cutting edge. In the winter if no one is going to see my legs, I don't care to whip out the wax per say. Basically I like to keep things simple. I just needed a razor to do the job until summer comes around when I start to care. So this is perfect for those times, when you don't really need a \\"Wax\\" kind of closeness but don't want to go around looking all beastly either. Perfect for times like winter or other times when you are in a big hurry and just need a little touch up or if you don't care much. Sometimes I use it if I am going out on errands and know no one is going to be looking at my legs up close. It doesn't get the closest shave ever, but does what I need it to. Great for travel too (like vacation, where you will never see those people again) kind of thing. Not travel like to see a new boss that you really need to impress. Basically what you expect out of a electric shaver, no more no less. I have had it a few months now and use it quite a bit and it has worked fine, still going strong battery and all!
  215. This is a great product. I'm glad my old one finally gave out because this one is much better. It does everything it claims and gives a comfortable shave.   221. works great for my purpose of shaving over psorasis
  222. My first electric shaver was a Remington and I loved it. It held a charge a long time, shaved close and never grabbed my skin. So when the battery finally gave out after several years I bought another Remington, the closest model I could find to the one I liked which was discontinued. Big mistake - the second Remington was a disaster! Didn't hold a charge, and even with brand new blades it grabbed the skin under my arms leaving red marks and left stubble on my legs. So, back to the drawing board. I read the Amazon reviews on a number of electric shavers and settled on this one. It's great! It is lighter weight than the Remington, shaves closer (amazingly close for an electric shaver) and holds a charge really well. It glides smoothly and never grabs my skin. I like the little clipper, too - the Remingtons didn't have that. The blades and foils are much easier to change than they were on the Remingtons also. This Panasonic is just an all-around great little electric shaver.<br /><br />First-timers should keep in mind that no electric shaver will ever give as close a shave as a razor. Those triple and quadruple razor blades made today shave really, really close. But I got tired of nicking myself and I really don't care about a super close shave so I switched to electric and never looked back. If you've never used an electric shaver before, there is a short period of adjustment while your skin gets used to the feel of it. Do a final shave with the razor and then use the electric shaver gently for a few days in a row before you tackle any major stubble; it should feel a lot better. If using it dry, make sure the skin is really, really dry - not damp. I find shaving in the shower uncomfortable so I prefer to shave dry, but the shaver seemed to do fine on wet skin the one time I tried it. I've had this shaver for almost a year now and replaced the blades/foil once so far. I'm still extremely pleased with it.
  223. Yahhhhhh! I have been searching for an electric razor that actually worked and this one does! The hair doesn't start to grow back for a week or more! Thank you soooo much! If you are thinking of purchasing this...do it!
  224. the first day the switch to pop up the edger blade broke. I had this shaver before for over 10 years. I bought a new one as the whole shaver cost less then replacing just the blades and it broke.
  225. Get a really close shave for an electric razor. I love it!
  226. Not as close a shave as using a razor, but great for everyday shaving while you are in the shower.
  227. I've tried just about every product out there, from those at-home waxing kits to the epilators and hair removing creams and hated just about every one of them, with razor shaving at the top of the list. I was so excited when I got this in the mail to try it out, and even though the directions recommend charging it for a full 12 hours it came out of the package fully charged and ready to go. I tried it in both wet and dry conditions, and with shaving creams as well as conditioner and it held up great under all conditions. I will say that it gets a much closer shave when in the shower and using conditioner and I have been super pleased with the results. The shave lasts much longer than regular razor shaving, and without the hazard of potential nicks and cuts. For longer hair, I recommend using the built-in trimmer first and then finishing up with the shaver for the best results. It works great on all areas, from legs and arms to the more sensitive areas like underarms and bikini areas. I didn't even wince when rotating to get to awkward nooks and crannies like with a dangerous razor! I highly recommend this product, it's super durable (I'm a complete klutz and have dropped it once or twice with no issues) and I did a lot of homework on comparable products before purchasing this one and I'm so glad I bought it!

As far as performance and ease of use and cleaning, it's super great. I keep it plugged in while I'm at work and it's always ready to use. I use it dry before I get in the shower. Figured even if it was mediocre, I wasn't out all that much money. Anyway, I am pleased to report that I agree with the positive reviews! It gives a nice, close shave and works really well for underarms. I did have some slight discomfort after the first use or so, but I think I was applying too much pressure, because with my old razor I had to, in order to get results. So I adjusted how hard I push this one while shaving, and I still get a close shave, but no razor burn. The only possible negative is the charger-it's just not the most convenient type for me. I'd rather have just a cord to charge with. And I guess it would be nice if the surface area of the shaver was larger in order to do legs more quickly, but I guess it's comparable to a regular razor, so I'm probably getting a little greedy here!

I have super sensitive skin and shaving with a razor in the shower gives me crazy itchy skin once the hair starts growing back in. With this, i'm able to quickly shave my legs (i do it on dry skin), get a close enough shave that even if you're up close/ touching me you wouldn't know i didn't just shave with a regular razor, and it doesn't irritate my skin at all.   380. ORIGINAL REVIEW (July 2, 2011): I was tired of getting razor burn from my cheap, disposable razors so I decided to ditch razors all together and get this instead after I saw it had good reviews. I have used it both wet and dry and in all honesty they both give just as good of a shave. It's a nice close shave (surprisingly as close as a razor) without leaving me red bumps the next day. You do have to be careful because if you angle it the wrong way you may pinch your skin and bleed a little. I found out if you lay it flat against your skin as much as possible then you can avoid this though. It just takes getting used to, but it is well worth it. It really is a good razor and for only $22 (that's how much I paid for it) it is not a bad deal at all!!<br /><br />I'd also like to add that you don't have to purchase batteries for this one. It recharges every time you plug it into your wall. The charge lasts for awhile as well. After I first charged it I shaved for maybe a total of 30 minutes so far and it's still going strong. I'll probably be charging it up anyway just to be safe for my next shave in a few days.<br /><br />UPDATED REVIEW (January 17, 2012): Ok, this product went from 5 stars down to 1 star. I had this razor for LESS than 7 months and as of today it no longer works at all. I originally thought it was dead, so I attempted to charge it by plugging it into the wall like I always have. The red light lit up to signal that it was charging, so I left it there for 12 hours. After 12 hours of charging I took it out, only to discover that it did absolutely NOTHING when I put the power switch on. It is as if it is completely dead and done with. All I have to say now is that this razor was amazing while it lasted. My original 5 star review would have remained had it not died on me after only 6 months of use.

  403. Your feelings about this product will depend on your expectations. Know going in that it will not replace a bare razor and it will work for you. If you need a quick shave but don't want to worry about cutting yourself while doing it, this is the way to go.<br /><br />The basics:<br />-Dry hurts. It pulls and pinches on dry skin.<br />-Wet hurts a lot less but doesn't give as close of a shave. I'm guessing water causes it to just slide over a lot hairs.<br />-Cream/gel/foam just blocks the blades. It's too thick for the head to grab the hairs.<br />-Plain soap seems to offer the best shave. No pain and the head can grab the hairs.<br /><br />I remember co-opting my late grandfather's electric razor (dry only) back in high school. It too pinched and gave a good but not great shave. I've deducted one point because electric razors haven't improved in 20 yrs.

  410. For the record, I've only used it once so if anything changes in the near future, I'll be sure to change my review.<br /><br />First of all, it came already charged so that was a surprise to me. It looked clean so I don't think it had been used and repackaged or anything, and I examined it really closely.<br /><br />It shaved my legs very well. Not ultra-smooth like you'd expect from a regular razor or from waxing, but good enough to last a day or two depending on how picky you are about prickly legs. I think it did as well as I'd expect from an electric shaver. I tried it briefly on my underarms but my skin didn't agree with it--not tight enough maybe? I had no chance at getting it smooth that way so I just used a regular razor in the shower for my underarms.<br /><br />It shaved my private area extremely well. No nicks or cuts. It pulled a little on the longer hair even after I trimmed it, but that was to be expected from something like this. It helps to go with the grain rather than against it at first. Overall, it did a very smooth job down there--the best I can get without waxing and without risking the Nair.<br /><br />I wish that the charger had a cord rather than plugging right into the wall. My electrical outlets in the bathroom are horizontal rather than vertical. I figured out that I can still plug it in that way with the razor charging, but I think it probably puts stress on the little prongs that go into the razor so I probably won't do that again, but find another outlet somewhere else in the house.<br /><br />It comes with a small white plastic-ish bag to put it in (the charger doesn't fit with it in there), so that was better than nothing which I was expecting.<br /><br />So far, so good.<br /><br />**Update 8/16/2016**<br /><br />I came on Amazon to look for another electric razor since this one is almost dead. It barely keeps enough charge to do one full leg anymore. I was hoping it would last more than a few years. And since it looks like this isthe &#34;best&#34; one you can get, I'm not sure if I'll buy another one or not.
  411. I'd tried using an electric shaver many years ago, and quickly tired of it, because of how poorly it worked. Since then, I'd gone back to a regular razor and shaving cream. Eventually though, this also wore me down, so I decided to research different ways to shave my legs, which brought me to this electric shaver here.<br /><br />It was remarkably easy to use, and the pop-up attachment for longer hair makes getting hard to reach areas a breeze. I was able to quickly shave both my legs while sitting down, using the dry setting -- it cut my shaving time at least in half.<br /><br />I also suffer from eczema and very sensitive skin; four days after my first shave with this device, my legs didn't feel nearly as itchy or dry as they normally do after shaving with a regular razor. They also were less nicked than usual, which definitely helped to lessen some of my skin irritation.<br /><br />As long as you follow the instructions carefully, this device here should make shaving so much easier! The fact that the price is so reasonable is also a definite bonus, too.<br /><br />My biggest qualm with the shaver is that it's kind of a pain to clean. This razor can be used in the shower, but I haven't tried that. It's very easy to clean, and it keeps a good charge that allowed me to shave both my legs entirely on the same charge. If you suffer from razor bumps, this may not be the electric razor for you. I was hoping to have better results with that based on the reviews I had read before deciding to purchase this product. It believe most women with normal skin/hair would be very happy with this razor. I happen to have extra sensitive skin and coarse hair that tends to become ingrown. If you suffer from the same shaving/skin problems, I would not recommend this razor.
  428. This is the best electric razor I've ever owned. Great price too. I like being able to use it wet or dry.
  429. Shaves close and lasts quiet awhile. This is my third. After a 2 years the batteries did not hold a charge long.
  430. Great for a quick shave when you don't want to break out another razor. Not as close has a non-electric, but pretty darn close.

My experience with Panasonic has been that they make quality stuff so either my shaver is an unusual circumstance or this is the result of purchasing one of the &#34;cheaper&#34; lady shavers...
  433. Pregnancy is a bummer. Bending over sucks, getting in and out of the tub sucks. And then it was spring and I really needed to shave my legs. I used my husbands electric razor a couple of times and decided to get my own. So I ordered this shaver. Being able to sit in a chair with my feet up and shave makes life so much easier. I've only ever used it dry and have had no problems with nicks. It's not a super close shave, but it does a good enough job to get rid of the appearance of stubble.<br /><br />I'm going to recommend it to all my pregnant friends. And once the baby is here it means I can do a quick shave without showering if I need to. I like that so many of the parts are replaceable. The reviews say the shaver doesn't last long. I've only had it over a month now, but I think the convenience for this time in my life has been well worth it.

However, though I have tried various methods of using this shaver on my bikini line (with and without cream/gel/soap, pulling my skin taught, various angles, etc.), it still nicks me every time. The trimmers on either side of the foil grab my skin and cuts me - not pleasant at all. I have given up trying.<br /><br />Update: lasted about a year, then died on me.

  454. Just got this razor last night, and for the price I am Very impressed! Other reviewers complained about it catching and pulling the hair quite a bit which I noticed as well! However, it wasn't fully charged either... so I stopped using it and let it charge overnight before using it again which made a Huge difference! So if you want to avoid the pulling, make sure it's fully charged! (it also helps to use shaving cream! Especially when shaving your bikini line!) It gives a great close shave, both wet and dry. I did have to go over some spots on my legs a couple times, but I had to do that with a regular razor anyways. The reason I gave it 4 stars was because it seems to die pretty quickly... it doesn't come to a full stop but the power is noticeably lower within 10 minutes of using it. I would absolutely recommend this razor to anyone!

  463. As an extremely hairy lady also gifted with pale and sensitive skin I have spent a significant amount of my life worrying about hair removal. I finally purchased this 15 years into my battle with the hairs and I couldn't be happier! I very rarely use my regular razor or wax anymore. This gets pretty close, definitely not as close as a razor, but good enough for me. I can use it on my thighs and bikini area and I only itch a little bit, NOTHING like what a razor does to me! I can finally wear shorts again!<br /><br />Just a few tips- I have coarse dark hair and found that the shaver works much better on dry skin. Also, go slowly, especially if your hair is longer, to avoid getting pulled on and to consistently trim the hairs down.

  476. I have used electric women's razors for probably 25-30 years -- and they sure have come a long way over the decades. These newer ones have much more comfortable shaves, and are contoured to fit your hand and your crevices!<br /><br />I received my Panasonic ES2207P a couple weeks ago, and am truly pleased with its performance. I immediately had to go on a five-day trip, so my new razor hit the trail with me.<br /><br />I love the compact charger: It was very convenient to be able to use the little wall charger/base (no long cord, no remote base, no batteries to purchase) and see him sitting on the wall next to the hotel sink in the mornings. I actually remembered to take him with me when I left the hotel.<br /><br />Use: It performs well. If your legs are DRY when you dry shave, he quickly and efficiently mows down all the stubble in one pass. If you are wet shaving (I like using a bit of hair conditioner for an inexpensive shave base), he glides along and gets even the little invisible hairs that normally get missed with a disposable, wet cartridge.<br /><br />Nooks & crannies: He very gently maneuvers into the most delicate of locations and without pinching can tidy up satisfactorily. I will leave it \\"at that.\\" (Let me mention that you need to pull the skin taunt to keep from pinching soft, thin, or delicate skin.)<br /><br />If you are new to electric razors -- this is a wonderful, inexpensive model to try out! At the worst, you are out $20 and can give it to your sister...<br />If you are an experienced electric razor user -- then this is one of the best models I've used at a surprisingly low price. I've purchased the super-expensive models in the past, hoping for better performance and longevity, and have always been disappointed in them.<br /><br />Overall, I would recommend the Panasonic ES2207P Ladies 3-Blade \\"Close Curves\\" Wet/Dry Shaver to my friends.

It shaves closely and has all the features more expensive shavers have--cordless, wet/dry, pop-up trimmer, floating heads. I've just used it dry where I have better lighting than in the shower. When I'd shaved with a blade in the shower, the lighting wasn't that good, I went mostly by feel, and would later see hairs, particularly on my knees, that I'd missed. This shaver gets them all and solves that problem. Wish I'd tried it a long time ago.

I would agree with those that said this isn't ideal for the bikini area, it is a bit large to get into tight areas and it does tend to \\"pull\\" hair when on the trim setting, but it isn't nearly as painful as waxing.<br />Since I was looking for something for legs and underarms I still gave it 5 stars because for those things it works great...plus I saw it in a local store yesterday for $40 MORE than I paid on Amazon.

  546. I've owned 4 other electric trimmers and this one is by far my favorite. It's cordless, rechargeable (nice low profile recharger--no cord) and gives me a nice close trim in my intimate areas with no injuries. For those ladies or gents that are cursed with an unmanageable jungle like me, this trimmer is up to the task! Just don't expect a smoothness associated with a close shave. I converted to trimmers years ago due to the irritation brought on by trying to shave. Just remember to use the trimmer first before you use the close trimming foil. You might want to use some small scissors before you trim if your're starting off au natural so you don't jam up the trimmer. Also, even though it's a wet dry trimmer....don't leave it in the shower! Take it apart, rinse it and let it air dry to prevent rust or damage.

It works great, I hardly have any rash after shaving. Now i can use it every day. I use it wet and dry. I don't like the trimmer that is why I gave it four stars. It was pulling on my hair. So i don't use it at all. Don't expect the same close shave as you get from a razor. I have been using it for over a month now and am very satisfied. I bought a second one for my stepdaughter. The battery life isn't very long but can't complain for the price. I am very happy not having any bumps on my legs, especially the bikini area.

  670. I recently purchased this shaver when my old purple Remington shaver went kaput. (I have no idea what model the Remington was - but I was unable to find that model anywhere to repurchase.) This Panasonic was actually the 3rd shaver that I bought to replace my old Remington - which was the best rechargeable shaver I've ever used.<br /><br />The first replacement shaver I purchased was a Remington - model WDF-3600 Smooth & Silky. I assumed that because it had the Remington name, it would work as well as my old shaver. I purchased it for $19.99 at a big box store. I followed the directions and charged it the recommended amount of time prior to trying it out. It would NOT shave my legs at all. No matter how I shaved - wet or dry - I went over the same section 10 times, and there was little to no difference visible from that section to the next. I returned it.<br /><br />The second replacement I purchased was another Remington - model WDF4830 Smooth & Silky. I paid $39.99 for it at another big box store. Again, I followed the directions and charged it the recommended amount of time, and then tried to shave. This shaver did get SOME of the hairs - but I had to go over the same area about 7 or 8 times for it to work decently (not well).<br /><br />I held onto it on the off chance that I couldn't find anything else that worked better, and went back to the store and purchased THIS Panasonic ES2207P Close Curves shaver. THIS ONE WORKS LIKE MY OLD SHAVER. It takes AT MOST 2 passes over the same section to have a very smooth/close shave. It is so very close to the same shave I get with my manual razor that I don't mind using it instead some days.<br />Again, I tried the $40 Remington side by side to the Panasonic - and the Panasonic is 150% better at getting a close shave. AND it is much quieter - which to me was not a big deal, but it is a nice feature.<br />The pop up trimmer is a nice feature as well.<br /><br />I have since returned the $40 Remington, and willthink twice before overlooking less expensive shavers next time. This Panasonic is fabulous!!

This Panasonic ES2207P is at least comparable to my Remington...maybe even better! It's light weight, requires one pass over of most areas (and I have very dark, coarse hair), and feels great in hand.   905. This is for the white model with pink sides, #ES2207P.<br /><br />I've used other brands for ladies shavers, but this one is wonderful!<br /><br />What I like about it:<br />It's smaller than other shavers, not bulky, easy to hold, handle, and maneuver.<br />It fits the hand well.<br />The directions say to go in an up-and-down, back-and-forth motion without lifting it from the skin. I do that and I'm elated with the result. It feels almost as smooth as a razor--no, not as smooth, but close!<br />I get absolutely no red lines or marks from the shaver.<br />I do not feel I need to push it hard into my skin to cut the hair.<br />I shave nowhere near as often as people would like me to--cuz I'm a bit hairy and I hate shaving. All that to say that despite how long the hair gets, it has not pulled hair, and it does not hurt to shave. However, I believe it is because I'm following the directions and not lifting the razor as I go up and down my legs or forearms.<br />I have never used this in water. It is always a dry shave for me.<br />The charge stays for a really long time. If I recall correctly, I think it is supposed to last for like 8 shaves. I got this at Christmas 2013, and I've only had to charge it 2-3 times. This is May 2014!<br />Some complain about it having a narrow head. I like the more narrow head being that I'm working around legs and arms that are not flat boards. ;)<br /><br />Forgive my lack of writing style. Been busy with other things in life, but felt I needed to post a positive about this shaver. To date, I am completely satisfied with this shaver.
  906. Of course it is an electric shaver so it does not shave as close as a razor. But, I have eczema so I cannot shave my legs with a razor and this is a wonderful alternative. I use it in the shower and it works great.
  907. This is one of the better razors I've used. I love that it's rechargeable and dont require me to change batteries. Plus a single charge lasts a really long time. The razor is simple to use and understand. Nice choice if anyone's looking for a new razor.
  908. This thing shaves so close, it's like using a razor with no cuts on your legs. I use it in the shower and I love it.

I pretty much settled for only shaving once or twice a week and only wears tank tops and swimsuits based off when I could shave. So anyway buying this was kind of a last resort before trying to get laser hair removal and it is amazing!! It is so gentle, from the first second I tried it I could tell there was no way it was going to irritate my skin and it doesn't. It's not quite as close as a shave as a razor but compared to not being able to shave with a razor, I'll happily take it. This unit is clearly heavier, thicker which makes maneuvering around your knees a bit tricky. I have small hands so holding this particular shaver wasn't comfortable.<br />2. Blades are not as sharp and leave stubble in their wake. The shave isn't nearly as good as with disposable razors. Period.<br />3. Cleaning this is a hassle.<br /><br />To me, the most important aspect of any shaver should be its ability to give you a fine, close shave without leaving stubs. Not so with this unit. Perhaps if you applied more pressure you might get a closer shave but then you risk cutting yourself. And I don't think so. Oh, and I've always used this wet with shaving cream and still the shave isn't as smooth. I'm not a hairy person to begin with either.<br /><br />So there you have my two cents. Now, this may be too much to share but I haven't shaved my legs in several months because I hate the whole production of using a manual razor and shaving cream. Plus, I have sensitive skin and get nicked several times even with good razors like Venus. Because of the amount of time that had passed, my leg hair was wirey and coarse. I attempted to use the electric shaver on dry legs even though the instructions said to use shaving cream. I didn't need the cream! It cut the leg hair REALLY close and did not cause any abrasions or rashes. I was able to get a close shave around my knees and ankles which, any woman knows, is VERY difficult to shave without nicking your skin! I am very happy with this razor, especially for the price I bought it. I just hope it lasts a long time.

What I DON'T like is the size of the head is too big for shaving in areas like vikini line or groin area. The extended shaver pulls the hair every now and then especially if hair is too long. Another feature I don't like it's the charging light. The red light never turns off or changes color or nothing so I never know when it's done charging or when battery is low! Unlike the Braun it has a light that blinks red when battery is red and solid green when charged. So in other words I'm still looking for that perfect electric shaver for women!

  1077. ** Original Review (5 stars) **<br />This works great. I've had it about 6 months now, and still works perfectly. Charges easily and I can get a few shaves out of one charge.<br /><br />** Update **<br />I bought this about a month after my son was born. With the exception of a few shaves with a razor I have used this religiously a couple times a week for almost 2 1/2 years. It was working great up until about a few months ago. The charge over the years has slowly been decaying. For the first year I could get in about 3ish shaves in between charges. The second year was closer to 2ish. Now I can't even get in a full shave. I'm pretty thorough about shaving and go over areas a few times to get the closeness that I like. I didn't mind because I could watch TV while shaving and it was relaxing. Now it dies within about 5 minutes after a full charge ( it takes me about a minute to do under my arms, and a few minutes for each leg). I downgraded the review because I had hoped to get more out of this but I am still keeping the review high because I only paid $20 for this thing, and it has given me over 2 years of great performance. I have sensitive skin and shaving with a razor usually results in pain and a rash unless I use the super expensive razors and high end shaving cream. This has saved me easily hundreds of dollars and paid for itself after the first couple months. This is one the closest shaves I've been able to get from an electric shaver. Nothing compares to a razor shave and you will not be able to obtain that with any electric shaver. To me this shave feels like next morning after a razor shave, or the next day after a razor shave. I am now starting to look into buying another electric shaver. This is a contender for me to purchase again, but I haven't finished researching the market yet. Overall I'm still happy with this purchase, but I did want to update my review with my experiences.

I also have sensitive skin and would get itchy after shaving my legs with a regular razor (from pressing down too hard). So, this electric razor eliminates razor burn, cuts and knicks, etc... I especially love this razor because I can now shave any time of day, versus only when I shower. I like to shave with this right before going somewhere and I usually do it while watching TV. It's a little noisy with its buzzing sound but not enough to really bother me. My sister used mine several times and loved it too so she bought one also. This thing is just plain convenient and AWESOME!!! I have to go over each stroke more than once to completely get all the stubble. But if you angle it right with all areas of the razor head flat against your skin and press down, you can get a pretty close shave quickly. I truly am in love with this razor!!

This shaver is almost as good as a razor. In reality the closeness of a razor only last for a day anyway. I can go right over the red blister and not worry about cutting it. I am on a learning curve still. Discovered you still need shaving cream or soap with the shaver. I like the fact that you can take it into the shower and that it is meant to get wet.   1152. I purchased this to replace a Panasonic ladies' shaver I'd bought 8 or 9 years ago. Unbelievably, this shaver works worse than the old, dull one. Very disappointing.
  1153. I solely use this shaver for my \\"woman area\\" and I LOVE this. I've been using this style/brand of shaver for ~7/8 years. And the one I'm currently using has been around for about 5/6 years and has survived PLENTY of drops! Still holds a charge for 3, maybe 4 shaves- (~8min/shave)<br /><br />This shaver is amazing. Very close shave- leaves me smooth & irritation free. I use the shaver after I shower and have thoroughly dried myself off- I feel it works best then for me.   1154. Bought this as a gift and I was told that it is the very first shaver that does not nip at your skin when shaving your underarms.   1157. It's been a long time since I've used an electric razor, but I wanted to give it a shot. I have had a pretty good experience with it so far. I use it without the water (dry), hence my reason for wanting to use an electric razor instead of a normal razor. It does a good job and cuts my shave time in half. In comparison, the only negatives is that it's not as close of a shave compared to using a non-electric razor with water and shave cream. I also have to shave about a day sooner, than if I used a regular razor. I find it's great for the summer though, when I'm shaving more frequently and it keeps everything smooth and clean in between major shaves. So overall a good product!

  1191. Excellent value and fast shipping.
  1192. This is a life saver for someone who hates shaving! I apologize for the long review beforehand, but I promise you, the details will help you make an informed purchase!<br /><br />------------------------------------------ BACKGROUND------------------------------------------------------<br />I'm used to getting my legs, arms, arm pits etc. waxed professionally once a month, back when I was in India. When I moved to the US, I realized how super expensive it is to get it done here, especially on a student budget! I tried waxing at home but there were always difficult patches which would turn sore and red because I couldn't hold the skin taut. Hence, like every one else, I started shaving!<br /><br />The problem was that I had never shaved before. Maybe once or twice in high school but that too when my mother was supervising me. I hated it. I hated spending extra time in the shower. I hated that it had to be done more often. I hated the cuts and razor burns. I tried shaving my arms once and it was a disaster. That's when I thought that I should probably look up electric shavers, and I found this one!<br /><br />------------------------------------------ REVIEW------------------------------------------------------<br />Close shave:<br />I think the main issue most people face with electric shavers is getting a close shave. If done right, this can give a close shave. hold the shaver perpendicular to the surface, so that the foil and both side of the trimmer are touching your skin. The trick is to go back and forth several times over the same area. There is a little bit of a spring action, so that you can, very gently, press it down on your skin, giving a closer shave. If you have longer hair, apply some talcum powder/baby powder and run a dry towel across the area in the direction opposite to the hair growth to lift the hair up. If you have really long thick hair (or if you are a guy shaving his legs), use the pop up trimmer to trim first.<br /><br />Battery life: Even though it said that it needs to be charged for 12 hours before the first use and between every use, I used it right out of the box to test it out on a small patch. It shaved well. I decided to wait 24 hours just to make sure I'm not getting any reaction, and charged it in the mean time. The blades did spin faster. So I believe it's a good idea to charge it between shaves. The manual says that 12 hours of charging gives about 20 minutes of shave, which sounds ridiculous at first. However, it took me, the amateur shaving person, 10 to 12 minutes to shave both legs, both arms and underarms. I think 20 minutes is more than enough.<br /><br />Wet shaving: Since I hated shaving, I don't think this is a feature I want to try. The manual says I can use this with some shaving cream, and I lot of reviews say that your skin needs to be soaking wet to shave. If I ever do try it, I will update this. I think it's unnecessary to wet shave when I'm getting very good results shaving it dry, however, I feel it's a good feature to have in case that's your only option, for example, if your sharing a hotel room with friends and don't have the privacy.<br /><br />Regrowth: Surprisingly, the regrowth was not as blunt as normal shaving, which is what gave me the confidence to shave my arms! You do have to let it grow a little longer than usual to shave well.<br /><br />Cleaning: It is extremely easy to clean. It comes with a dual ended brush to brush of hair during the shave. After I am done shaving, I pop the head off and rinse both, the head and the blades inside in water. It's a good idea to press your finger onto the faucet so that it gives out a sharp forceful stream. I first rinse the head, then put a some hand soap in some water in a cup, and leave the head in that to soak while I clean the blades inside. I first rinse the blades in the sharp stream, then I dunk the blade only in the cup full of soap water and swish it around, and then rinse both the head and the blades. I use a q tipto get into the corners of the plastic inside. To dry off, I sort of shake both the parts vigorously so that the water falls out, put the top back on to protect the blade, and leave it to air dry for a few hours. Once I know it's fully dry, I put it for charging.<br /><br />Ergonomics: For dry shaving and washing, it's very easy to hold. It fits well in my small hands and doesn't slip out of my grip. I don't know if the surface will become slippery if you're shaving wet with shaving cream. The placement of the buttons is good so that you can start and stop the shaver or open and close the pop trimmer with the thumb of the hand you're holding it with. I believe the design is good for both, right handed and left handed people. The side of the the blade is big enough for quick shaves, and small enough to get around difficult areas.<br /><br />Portability: If you have the right case to carry it in, it's easily portable. The case that comes with it is too small to fit both the shaver and the charger. This is my only complaint. Other than that, it's not too bulky and heavy to travel with.<br /><br />Longevity: Only time will tell. I have had it only for a few weeks and used it 3-4 times, and so far it's great. The blade and the foil are replaceable, so that's a good think. Other than that, if you read the manual, follow the instructions, keep it clean and charge it timely, you're doing everything on your side to maintain the product. If anything goes wrong or I face any issues, I will come back and update this.<br /><br />Overall, I think it's a good product, very affordable (I bought it for 14.99, the original price is 29.99, which is still great if it lasts for more than a year), it does the job well without nicks and cuts, and it is FAST!<br /><br />If you found this review helpful, give it a thumbs up! If you have any questions, please comment below and I will try to answer them to the best of my knowledge. Have a great day! :)to get into the corners of the plastic inside. To dry off, I sort of shake both the parts vigorously so that the water falls out, put the top back on to protect the blade, and leave it to air dry for a few hours. Once I know it's fully dry, I put it for charging.<br /><br />Ergonomics: For dry shaving and washing, it's very easy to hold. It fits well in my small hands and doesn't slip out of my grip. I don't know if the surface will become slippery if you're shaving wet with shaving cream. The placement of the buttons is good so that you can start and stop the shaver or open and close the pop trimmer with the thumb of the hand you're holding it with. I believe the design is good for both, right handed and left handed people. The side of the the blade is big enough for quick shaves, and small enough to get around difficult areas.<br /><br />Portability: If you have the right case to carry it in, it's easily portable. The case that comes with it is too small to fit both the shaver and the charger. This is my only complaint. Other than that, it's not too bulky and heavy to travel with.<br /><br />Longevity: Only time will tell. I have had it only for a few weeks and used it 3-4 times, and so far it's great. The blade and the foil are replaceable, so that's a good think. Other than that, if you read the manual, follow the instructions, keep it clean and charge it timely, you're doing everything on your side to maintain the product. If anything goes wrong or I face any issues, I will come back and update this.<br /><br />Overall, I think it's a good product, very affordable (I bought it for 14.99, the original price is 29.99, which is still great if it lasts for more than a year), it does the job well without nicks and cuts, and it is FAST!<br /><br />If you found this review helpful, give it a thumbs up! If you have any questions, please comment below and I will try to answer them to the best of my knowledge. Have a great day! :)

So you can see a TINY bit of stubble left behind. It looks like if you shaved closely with a razor and then waited about 5-6 hrs.... just tiny specks of hair left behind. No biggie.<br /><br />On me, I can go two days before you can even see a thing because I'm blonde.<br /><br />It works great... DRY.<br /><br />Cons -- It sucks wet. Even if I sweat just a bit, or have too much lotion on, it clogs and then surprise, becomes an epilator and yanks out your hair left and right in the most agonizing ways. And, if you hit it wrong against certain delicate areas, it will gouge a quarter inch chunk of skin off of you. But I've shaved with it about 10 times and this has only happened twice.... so uh.. stick to your legs and other flat surfaces and you should be fine....

  1300. We have purchased 2 of these shavers for my daughter, both have stopped working. The 1st was a throw away, the second was this: [I can tell you that I took apart this shaver, as my daughters quit working as well. the charge disengage slide switch had some corrosion on it. I used 600 grit sand paper, cleaned the contacts, dabbed some tri flow (protectant) onto the contacts and now the unit is working again. This should not happen, though even a little moisture with allow for corrosion.]

About ten years ago I finally upgraded to a Venus which was mediocre, then a Schick several years later [which I still love], but then after stealing my brother's beard trimmer I realized that electric razors are WAY better. I did some research, and this was something in my price range that sounded good.<br /><br />I've recommended this Wet/Dry shaver to so many women! All with the same reaction, &#34;They make those for women?&#34; Yes! And I don't get awful bumps any more! I still get ingrown hairs, but not painful ones. I generally use this dry in the morning before running out the door, but it works well in the shower.<br /><br />Pros:<br />*No more nicks, cuts, or bumps.<br />*Easy to use.<br />*Small enough to store, doesn't take up too much room.<br />*Reusable, and cheaper than buying disposable blades/razors.<br />*Has close shave, and a pop-up trimmer.<br /><br />Cons:<br />*Trim longer hairs before using the trimmer [otherwise they get caught].<br />*Have to charge after each use, otherwise if it sits in the draw for a bit I only get one leg shaved the next time.<br />*It has to be plugged in to charge--there's no cord to charge it while you use it.<br />*Hard to plug anything else in the outlet other than this.

  1340. I purchased the exact same razor from Target because it was on sale for $17.99 because I wanted to be able to return it if It didn't work out for me without paying return shipping since I've never tried an electric razor. I gave it a try because the razor blade cartridges are just so expensive. What a pleasant surprise! This little razor rocks! I use it on my legs, arms and bikini area. I use a traditional razor on my underarms because I just can't seem to get the right angle, but I think it would work for most people.<br />You use the pop up adjustment for your bikini area. It works equally well wet in the shower or dry outside of the shower. I prefer to use it dry because I can watch TV while I've shaving and it doesn't seem like such a chore. No more nicking my legs and no more red razor bumps! You do need to be a little careful on certain areas of your bikini line because you can cut yourself with the pop up adjustment.<br /><br />You will need to go over your legs several times, unlike a traditional razor. I think this is why some people plain that the shave isn't as close. They're just giving it one pass by. If you expect a close shave on your legs with just one swipe you will be disappointed. It does take several, but who cares it you're watching TV? I do just one swipe on my bikini area and arms and works fine. I've had my razor for about 2 months now and I'm very happy with it.

  1390. Works well dry or wet! Good price...easy to use and recharge!
  1391. I charged this bad boy for the initial 12 hours and after a month I still haven't had to recharge it. I use it just to shave armpits and probably average about once a week, so not very long, but it works great. A few things to note, use it in shower with water pouring down or when you are completely dry. Do not even think about attempting to shave a sweaty or damp armpit. You will have a razor burn unlike anything you could imagine. Wet great. Dry great. Damp=screaming armpit agony.
  1392. Funny, no sooner had I plugged in the shaver to charge, than my husband came to me with a grin on his face and showed me his freshly shaven neck.<br /><br />I said, &#34;Hey, that's not yours!&#34; (but it did a good job even on his chicken neck)<br /><br />As for me -- I'm thrilled to have an electric shaver again and this is just what I wanted.
  1393. I guess no electric razor can give you the same shave you get from a blade, but this does an acceptable job. My legs feel nice and smooth when I shave them, but are stubbly by the next day.   1394. I bought this shaver in March and was so excited about using it for the summer season. I have thick, dark hair on my legs so shaving would often be irritating, not to mention the annoyance of razor burn and cuts. I thought an electric shaver would eliminate these things. (Plus, this is a great, cheap shaver to try out.)<br /><br />And it has! I had resorted to shaving with the grain with a traditional razor (to avoid ingrown hairs) and this shaver gets my legs smoother than that. Granted, I usually would use this shaver every day or every other day, but the fact that it can be used dry makes it so much easier to use daily. I've never tried it wet, but dry is just so much easier (just make sure your legs are actually dry and not damp, otherwise it will hop around). I also put it on the charger every day after I use it (mostly so I know where it is), so I have never had a problem with the battery dying mid-shave.<br /><br />The only annoying thing has to do with the nature of the foil shaver itself... so if you get lazy and don't shave for a week or two, you really need to use the trimmer blades to shorten the hair before using the foil portion. I think you can do maybe three, possibly four days in-between foil shaves. Regardless, I still prefer it to a razor. I've had absolutely no irritation and very very few (if any) ingrown hairs.<br /><br />I've told most of my friends about using an electric shaver, and after feeling how smooth my legs are, almost all of them want to try it! This shaver has made summer (and shaving) so much easier for me and I can't recommend it enough!<br /><br />Sidenote: If you wear glasses, this shaver is a great idea. It's so hard to see your legs in the shower when you can't wear glasses, but the ability to use this shaver dry makes that problem non-existent!
  1395. This is a great little shaver for the price. It is fairly sturdy, does a pretty good job, and the battery carries a good charge. I have to recharge it less than half as often as previous, more expensive models. It's light-weight, which is a plus for someone like me with carpel tunel issues, and easy to use. It may not get as close as old-fashioned razors, but for an electric shaver it does well.
  1396. I don't think that the shave is as close as my previous shaver. Otherwise, it is OK. The price was very good.

  1413. I love this thing! I read some reviews that said their's stopped working, but I've been using mine for over a year and a half and it's still going strong! When I first bought this I was desperately trying to find something to shave with for my twin brother's wedding. I was a bridesmaid and the dress was short. Every time I used a razor I got little red bumps that burned and itched. I tried numerous razors, shaving creams, soothing products, etc. NOTHING worked. I really didn't want to have polka-dotted legs at my brother's wedding.<br />That's when I came across this. I was really excited at the idea, since it said it was great for sensitive skin. It wasn't too expensive, so I tried it. It worked great! My legs were smooth and there wasn't a bump or burn in sight! This is the only thing I will shave with!<br />It works both wet and dry for me. Dry is great when I get sudden invites to go swimming or hot-tubbing, and wet is great for in the shower. It's quick, easy and painless!   1417. I bought this about 10 weeks ago, looking for an alternative to cartridge razors. It worked fine for awhile; it didn't give me a really close shave, but I prefer that to the hell that is razor burn EVERYWHERE. However, one day I picked it up after charged, and it wouldn't turn on! I thought, &#34;That's OK, that happens, I'll just call warranty service to get a battery replacement.&#34;<br /><br />But Panasonic's warranty service is a joke! Their phone tree never lets you talk to anyone - it just advises you to try online. But their online warranty website appears to be inoperable - you can't do anything without an account, but account creation appears to be irrevocably broken. So the 2-year limited warranty for product failure is essentially null and void from the start. I found this very frustrating - not really because of the money I lost, but because of the poor business practices exhibited.<br /><br />My advice to any women considering this product due to sensitive skin: try safety razors instead. You get a closer shave, free from razor burn, and since it's all-mechanical, the chances of the razor randomly breaking one day are about zero (Michael Ham's book on shaving is a good beginner's resource). But if you're really set on an electric razor, buy one that either has a removable batteries, or a razor with a company other than Panasonic.
  1418. Good product and uneventful service.

  1423. Pros:<br />* Compact shape, easy to hold.<br />* Works wet or dry, making it wonderfully flexible. Personally I think it works a bit better on dry skin, but if I forget to do it first thing, I can just as easily bring it in the shower. (It does not work as well on skin fresh out of the shower.)<br />* Good battery. Lasts for a few shaves and if you don't shave often, does not seem to drain between shaves. I'm not sure of its max charge since I tend to recharge it after a few uses, but I've never had the annoyance of having the charge run out mid-shave.<br />* Does not shave as closely as a razor -- no electric shaver will -- but closer than the other two electric shavers I've owned in the past.<br />* Easy enough to clean. Bottom third pops out partially, blow on it. Whole thing pulls out if additional cleaning is needed.<br />* Surprisingly durable. I heard an odd buzzing sound from our front-loading washer one afternoon. Opened it up mid-cycle and found this shaver, buzzing away. It had somehow fallen into the hamper and then made its way to an unintentional deep cleaning, and been switched on as it bounced up and down and around. Pulled it out, shook it off, and crossed my fingers. Months later, it still looks and functions as if brand new.<br /><br />Cons:<br />* None that I've found yet.
  1424. I bought this for my wife for Christmas (2014) after reading the reviews. New Years Day, I asked how she liked it so far. She says it's great for her legs as it causes no skin irritation, unlike razors. But, she refuses to use it on more sensitive areas because it pulls hair occasionally. I doubted this, so attempted to shave my 2-day facial hair growth with it. Ouch! Every once in awhile, it in fact DOES pull hair! I researched the Panasonic website, users manual, and can't see that we're using it wrong. It has sat on the charger plenty. It just is what it is, I suppose. I've been using a Panasonic ES8243 for 3 years (Christmas present from wife) and have only changed the blades ONCE. No hairs pulled and it still runs like a top. We both agree that mine is the better razor.
  1425. Like using it in the shower, but shave not as close as I would like.
  1426. I have waited a long time to write this review, since I wanted to be absolutely sure before I gave it the glowing recommendation I felt it deserved. I first purchased this razor 2 years ago, and it drastically changed my life. It cuts close enough to be smooth, but not close enough to give me ingrown hairs or razor burn. It's a dream around the bikini line--so much easier and cheaper than waxing, and (as long as you exfoliate afterward) no little red bumps.<br /><br />About three months ago, I started getting very sad, since my little razor just wasn't cutting it anymore (haha). I had to do three or more passes to get my legs really smooth. I started doubting if this panasonic razor had ever been as awesome as I had thought it was. So do you know what I did? I came back to Amazon and ordered another one. It came in a couple weeks ago, and I'm back in the dream life. Quick, fast, close shaves that leave me falling in love all over again.<br /><br />SO, here is the conclusion. The warranty on this buddy is 2 years long, which is how long it takes the blade to dull with constant use. Either way, you're going to be getting about 2 years of good shaves out of the Panasonic. Is that worth $18? Why yes. Yes it is. I think I saved that much on shaving cream alone by using it. I wholeheartedly recommend this one to anyone interested in making the switch to electric. IT WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE.<br /><br />A few notes on usage: If you have anything more than stubble on your legs, you're really going to want to use the pop-up trimmer first. This doesn't slow you down too much though, since you can just do some quick swipes and then switch to the foil. Also, this is a wet/dry razor, but I definitely prefer to use it dry. It gets closer, and it means no shaving cream involved. I just take it into the shower, shave, and then turn on the water. Finally, make sure that your razor is fully charged each time you use it, or you won't be seeing it at 100%.

  1505. This product is a convenient alternative to shaving with a razor in the shower, but with a few big caveats.<br /><br />First, no matter what technique I try, the shaver always pulls some of my hair and occasionally knicks me. The trimmer is even worse - it pulls hard enough around areas that would be veiled should I be in a bathing suit that I refuse to use it anymore. Again, this occurs no matter how slowly I go, how charged the shaver is, or from what angle I approach my legs. I have yet to have an ouch-free shave.<br /><br />Second, the dry option doesn't work very well for me. By this I mean that I have to go over the same spot about three times in order to get an even shave. Even then, the final result is still just okay. I can feel and see more stubble than my old (OLD) Remington wet/dry shaver used to leave behind. The wet option does a much better job for me, but only when I use a thick shaving cream. As long as I do that, and don't mind the shaver knocking off a good bit of the cream on surrounding areas not yet shaved, I get a very smooth and close shave with only minimal tugging.<br /><br />I also find the power charger annoying, as I do not always have access to a plug that has space for the razor to sit on top in the vertical orientation.<br /><br />Despite these issues, I keep this around for the times when I need a quick touch-up and don't have access to or time to take a shower, simply because I haven't found a better option.
  1506. This shaver is exactly what I was looking for. I've never had an electric one before, so I didn't really know what to expect, but the shave wasn't quite as close as I was hoping for. BUT it's fine if I'm in a hurry in the morning and I feel like wear shorts that day!
  1507. For the price this is worth a try. I love it. I shave my legs dry and it does a fabulous job. My underarms are a little more \\"sensitive\\" and the first time I used it on my pits, I used soap and water.....it did the job better than a razor but I had alot of irritation and a rash, so the next time I lathered up with sensitive shaving cream and had no rash or \\"burn\\". Haven't used it in my \\"girl\\" place yet, but I'll be lathering up with the sensitive shave cream first :-) I will recommend this shaver.
  1508. Just got mine yesterday and I'm already in love. I have a spinal injury and shaving is terribly difficult. I have to sit in a chair in the shower and can't do all the bending over to shave. I decided recently to give electric shavers another try, figuring if I had the same result as before, at least it would get my hair short enough that I could shave it with the razor.<br /><br />This shaver is nothing like my previous one.   1583. I ordered this for my wife. She prefers what she already had. Not to waste, I tried it. I have a beard, but I do shave my neck. Being lazy, I don't shave every day and the hair grows out. With a beard, I can get away with it for about 3 days before it looks tacky. I have a Norelco Rotary, a Remington standard, and a Braun, from when I had no beard. I also own a beard trimmer with attachments. None come close to this razor for trimming my neck. The other razors do not work unless I shave every day. They can't pick up the hairs if they are longer. The beard trimmer attachment works, but must be followed up with shaving to remove stubble. Safety razors clog when the hair is a bit long and then do not cut until the hair is rinsed off. With this razor, I can run it along my neck and the trimmers on both sides of the foil cut the longer hairs, and the foil portion finishes it off. With a few passes, I get the quickest shave with the least pain. Kind of surprising that using an inexpensive \\"women's\\" razor works far better than my men's razors that cost 4-5 times as much. Although a very, very light stubble may remain, it cannot be seen, only felt. So on special occasions, (about once a month), I finish it off with a safety razor. I've used it for about a year and it is still going strong.

  1645. I was really excited for this razor to arrive. It was something of an experiment for me, never having used an electric razor before. I have thick dark hair and fair skin so I'm alsways interested in anything that might make shaving easier and less irritating. I've found that the razor is good to have around for quick touch ups, for instance when you want to go to the gym in shorts or short yoga pants but have significant stubble on your lower legs.The shave will not be as close as when you use a regular safety razor in the shower. It lasts me about a day. This electric razor does have one other advantage: It seems to irritate my underarms less than a safety razor does, especially when you want to do a touch up but just shaved them the day before. So, it's useful to have around but I would not use it everyday. Perhaps for others with lighter or thinner hair this would be enough to use as a primary razor.<br /><br />One big disadvantage is that the razor casing developed a crack shortly after I began using it. It's a hairline crack that runs from the purple curve on the handle section horizontally across the white part ending at the next purple bit. It doesn't seem to affect the performance of the razor at all but I'm reluctant to bring it into the shower now.

  1720. I purchased this specifically for the &#34;Bikini&#34; function, so, that's what I'm going to refer to, in detail.<br />I think the idea of a stranger spreading things, putting warm wax there then ripping it off is horrifying, so I was seeking an alternative to get the area smooth and hair-free. While this shaver has a &#34;pop-up trimmer&#34; for &#34;longer hairs,&#34; by longer hairs, they must mean a few millimeters, because when I ran it over hair 1/4-inch to 1/2-inch long, it constantly got tangled and yanked the hair out from the root. And it hurt a lot. So that was a fail, and I'd recommend shaving with a regular razor first if possible or trimming with scissors before using this shaver. (Which I wanted to avoid, which is why I bought this darn thing!)<br />Like other reviewers mentioned, it's REALLY hard to get a smooth shave with this device (and likely, with any electric shaver). But for the bikini region, it's pretty essential, as little short spiky hairs with a sharply-cut edge in that region are pretty uncomfortable. I found that pulling the skin as taut as possible, changing the direction of the shaver path repeatedly, reapplying whatever soap/shaving cream/lubricant you use multiple times, and doing about a million passes did, eventually get a smooth finish. And there are just places you can got with the foil-covered shaver that I wouldn't dare with a razor or scissors. I think the &#34;20-minute&#34; battery-life after a 12-hour-charge is unreasonable, but it lasted long enough for me to get the job done. So, it works, and I'd recommend it if you want to go full Brazilian but waxing scares you.
