  1735. I did not open the box even. Upon opening the Amazon box, I was immediately concerned about my purchase for personal reasons that another potential purchaser with similar needs might appreciate knowing.<br /><br />After years of using regular steel disposable razors or various Venus razors, I was put on some serious blood thinners for a health issue. For the unforseeable future, I cannot use disposable razors (too great a risk of cutting self and bleeding). I researched like crazy and landed on this ES2207P...reviews, Good Housekeeping, and product claims seemed to tout it as a best-in-class razor for a gentle shave, close as possible with as near zero chance of cutting oneself as presentable.<br /><br />Not sure after seeing it (even in box still). Why?<br /><br />1) It is a BIG chunky device...as big as my entire hand (maybe 8&#34;?).<br />2) Granted it's in a box still but it is HEAVY!<br />3) The &#34;close cut&#34; blades are on both sides.of the foil and appear sharp (as any sort of double-pass razor teeth are) but they do appear to jut out at a higher elevation than the rather large foil head...would be too hard to get smaller areas.<br /><br />Overall, this seems too big, too heavy, and the double-pass &#34;close shave&#34; blades really spooked me as someone on blood thinners who can assume zero risk of cutting self. So, for the general user who has a larger body canvas this might be worthy of 5 stars. But for this petite person with blood thinner risks at hand...it gets 2 stars and without opening the product box, it will get shipped back.<br /><br />Next, I will purchase something more like a Clio palm-size shaver. That was the other that I kept waffling over when finally settled on this purchase. I wish I had followed my gut then...but instead I'm following my gut now.
  1736. Bought this for a christmas present. My mother liked it so much SHE wanted one :) perfect gift for the ladies!
  1737. Works great and is rather quiet. The charge lasts a long time too.
  1738. excellent product and service.
  1739. I've read so many complaints about this and other electric shavers that I thought I ought to clarify a few things and help everyone get a smooth, non-injurious shave.<br /><br />First a heads-up: you will never get quite as smooth with an electric shaver than you will with a razor, but you can get pretty close. For me, this is an advantage because I can shave more often and avoid razor burn, but if you have dark hair and light skin where every tiny bit of stubble shows, then you may want to stick with a razor.<br /><br />Now, on to the actual shaving advice:<br /><br />First of all, friction is responsible for most of your nicks and also for those extremely painful incidents where a small bit of skin gets caught by the shaver. When the blades spin fast, friction is reduced. You need to make sure your shaver is fully charged before you use it. Although this shaver theoretically holds a charge for multiple shaves, I don't advise you to try it. Charge that baby all the way each and every time you use it! If you are using it on your underarms or bikini line, you will probably want to do those areas first, when the shaver is at its most powerful.<br /><br />Second, This is a wet/dry shaver, not a damp shaver. It needs to glide smoothly over your skin, and if your skin is only damp, like from the bath or from sweating in a humid bathroom, it's going to be tacky and the shaver will skip rather than glide, and you will be forced to press down harder to keep contact - this can also cause nicks and cuts. So make sure your skin is either totally wet or totally dry. I do mine after the shower and use a hair-dryer on low to totally dry off my skin before I use it.<br /><br />Finally, unless you are just doing a touch-up shave, you must cut your hair down with the clipper setting before you use the foil. The foil is for cutting very short hair down to skin level, but it is going to catch and pull any hair that is longer. If your hair is long enough to be cut by the clippers, you need to use them first before letting the foil touch your skin.<br /><br />I hope that this advice will give you a wonderfully smooth and satisfying shaving experience with this or any electric shaver you decide to buy.need to use them first before letting the foil touch your skin.<br /><br />I hope that this advice will give you a wonderfully smooth and satisfying shaving experience with this or any electric shaver you decide to buy.
  1740. Appears to work well. Light and slim design easy to handle. I have only tried this dry, but assume the wet use will be even better. Pleased with this purchase.
  1741. I was sort of skeptical ordering this electric razor. My grandmother had given me an old one back in the 1990s that never did a thing, but I was hoping that maybe ladies electric razors had improved a bit since then. Well, not only have they improved, but I swear that I got as good as a shave on my legs as I ever have with a razor. Well worth the very reasonable price for this razor! I will be surprised if I even use my razor on my legs in the shower again for the rest of the summer.<br /><br />I haven't tried the razor under my arms yet, but honestly that wasn't really why I bought the razor. Traditional shaving under my arms has never bothered me...it was always having to do my legs that drove me up the wall. So you might want to read through some of the other reviews if that is why you are looking at purchasing this electric razor. But for my purposes (namely my legs), I'm 100% satisfied (and then some).

Good riddance!

  1745. I am so glad that I found this razor on Amazon, received one for Christmas several years ago and it died on me. I tried others but no comparison to this product. I really like this razor because you can use it in the shower or not.
  1746. Love this shaver. Gave me a close shave without ANY nicks or cuts. It is also fairly quiet. The pop-up trimmer is great and really does work for longer or stray hairs. I'm never going to go back to a regular razor again. I hardly have to do any \\"passes\\" over my skin with this shaver compared with a regular razor, so it saves alot of time. This shaver is also far more economical than a regular razor. The prices razor companies are charging for replacement blades is highway robbery. However the blade in this shaver only needs to be replaced once a year. p.s. I think it is also important to note that I previously tried the Norelco Bodygroom shaver due to the many positive reviews, however I got razor burn from that shaver and also got cut quite badly in several places. Not the case with the Panasonic. The difference between the two is night and day. This shaver will not leave you dissapointed. Highly recommend!
  1747. I enjoy using this product, because it is light weight and easy to control, it's not so noisy and it is a nice color. This is a good shaver for women who have to use them and it keeps a charge for a week. I also like the fact that it is not very expensive.

  1775. Definitely not as close a shave as a razor, even from the very beginning. I just wanted something to make shaving less tedious and even a little easier.   1776. I've had this shaver for over 4 years now. Original charger & original battery, amazingly. I think I paid about $17 for it. So after probably hundreds of hours of use, I don't really blame it for dying without any notice. That being said, about 2 years in, it started getting funky. The first time it didn't turn on I thought it was done for good. I accidentally dropped it on the floor and it magically sprung to life. Every couple uses after that it would play dead and I would have to hit it against a wall or literally throw it on the floor and it would begin working again. This went on for 2 years until it stopped working for good the other day.<br />This shaver was my first and only so far. It did its job fairly well. Usually not painful unless I was being quick and careless which sometimes lead to it pulling at my skin.<br />Shaving definitely takes time and effort with this though. If you have coarse body hair, one pass won't do the job. Several times over will probably get the job done. I also have very sensitive skin. This shaver generally did not irritate my skin. I can't shave with anything but my legs with a non-electric razor, so this is a life saver. I generally used it on my bikini area and if you're careful, it can actually be used for a full brazillian too.<br />It took a bit of trial and error to figure out how to get the perfect shave with this razor. I found that it works best in the shower with shaving cream and hair length is a major factor in the success of the shave. Hair should be about 1/4&#34; or it's difficult to get a close shave.<br />Overall, it hasn't been an absolutely amazing experience.. but it wasn't necessarily a bad one either, but after many years with this razor, I'm ready to upgrade. I would recommend this shaver to someone who is totally new to electric shaving. It's cheap, lasts quite a while and is a good, forgiving shaver to start with. That way you can learn the ropes before switching to the speedy, extra sharp razors.

  1787. I only paid $12 for this through Amazon Warehouse deals, and I am very happy with this shaver. I think it's also very inexpensive on the Panasonic website with free shipping, so keep that in mind. I wouldn't bother getting any replacement foils or blades, they would cost more than just getting a new shaver.
  1788. And I've been using them for a good 30 years (various makes). I often don't have time to shave with a blade, and there are some areas of my body I don't like to use a regular blade on, so I've found using electric shavers to be very convenient. I can honestly say that this is the best of the bunch. First time I used it (on clean, dry skin), the shave was so close that it 'almost' felt like I'd used a blade. If you've never used an electric shaver, there are a few tips and tricks to know (that some of the other reviewers have mentioned). For me, besides the skin being clean and dry, it helps when the hair is a bit longer than nub length (when the hair is a bit longer, the shaver gets a better cut), and using a circular motion is also very effective. Sometimes it also helps to pull the skin taught so that the shaver is getting as close to the surface of your skin as possible (closest cut). This shaver is shaped nicely so that it's comfortable in your hand, and it's pretty light weight. I highly recommend this shaver. It's a bargain at $19.
  1789. Great lady's shaver and great price and shaves close and give the best shave ever .If you do like rainy says to shave you'll get a good shave and will leave you smooth

  1796. Different bodies, different skin, it stands to reason every lady will have different types of hair too.<br /><br />I have dark blonde hair, but my leg and armpit hair comes in between thick/thin, and dark black. When I was a kid, my mother taught me to shave with a hand held razor blade--10-15 years ago, electric shavers couldn't compare at all. Especially with my leg hair. I tried one, once, an itty bitty thing on my legs and all it did was pull hair, scrape my skin and leave an awful red road-like rash. So back then (eons ago, when we women clacked rocks together to communicate) I dismissed electric shavers entirely.<br /><br />This Christmas (2013) I was lucky to have the family gift me a few extra dollars to spend on my own gifts. I started thinking about the fact that I shave less as I get older, and the utterly ridiculous prices on razors for women, razor kits--and wondered--how much has changed in electric razors from my rock clacking days?<br /><br />This shaver caught my eye. 1.) Perfectly and reasonably priced. Wet and Dry--meaning if I was taking a shower or bath I could weed wack my legs into some semblance of smoothness or if I was just running out the door and was starting some five o'clock shadow I could fix it up and keep going. 2.) High ratings and reviews from the lovely people of Amazon. So I said, &#34;Let's do (sheer?) it!&#34;<br /><br />Arrived really fast--four days; packaged perfect. No damage to the package or the box the shaver came in. Relatively simple and easy to open with no-nonsense instructions.<br /><br />First thing I noted was how super light and perfect it felt in hand. Second thing I noticed is that it recommends replacing the inner blade ONCE. A. YEAR. Comparing to how much I spend on razors a week/two weeks--I am seeing saving myself dollar signs.<br /><br />Second thing I did was IMMEDIATELY put it on it's charger and let it sit all day. I read an earlier review that said to make sure it was fully charged for the better shave and use.<br /><br />So--fast forward to night time, I hop in the shower and make sure to soak my legs, armpits very well and let the steam from the shower work a bit before grabbing this baby and going to mow-town. Turning it on revealed it didn't sound like I was in a nest of really loud, really angry hornets--so that was an immediate plus. I used shaving cream on my legs and arm pits and began shaving.<br /><br />Legs: Not a single issue. No leg hairs were pulled, mangled or caught. I didn't cut anything and nothing stung.<br />Arm pits: 1 arm pit went smooth as baby bottoms. The other armpit I noticed that some of my skin was getting caught/immediate red bumps rash. I'm pretty sure that it's the shape of that armpit, because I have used the razor every night since then and the same spot catches.<br /><br />I am sure that the shape of your legs, your skin type and body hair type, how long it's charged and how clean it is all contributes to how well this razor works or not. I haven't had any red bumps/rashes or pulled skin on my legs EXCEPT for the one armpit.<br /><br />NOTE: I haven't tried this razor on dry skin, and I am not sure I will because the results in the shower with shaving cream is almost exactly like that of using a hand-held razor.<br /><br />Too long: didn't read summary: I would recommend this razor for ladies with light to medium thick body hair. It works like a charm in the shower/bath with shaving cream. It's remarkably affordable, the rechargable batteries can be replaced with better ones if you like, and it's easy to handle. My legs are smooth and it's already saved me money. Check it out, kay?and use.<br /><br />So--fast forward to night time, I hop in the shower and make sure to soak my legs, armpits very well and let the steam from the shower work a bit before grabbing this baby and going to mow-town. The only thing I could complain about is that it doesn't come in other colors..   1844. This is a great lady shaver and it is very reasonably priced. I had two older Remington lady shavers and needed a new shaver as my cord had deteriorated and I couldn't get a new cord for my Remington. I was looking for a corded shaver but no one seems to makes corded anymore so I had to look at shavers with rechargeable batteries. I hated having to deal with batteries as that runs up the cost of using. I looked and read reviews. This seemed to be the best one and one of the cheapest. Well, it is the best one. It gives you a close shave better than my old shaver. It must be charged for 12 hrs before using. It is easy to clean as the top/blades snaps off and can be rinsed/washed under the faucet with soap and water. You get a brush with it which helps to brush the residue from the shaving head after shaving. The charger snaps on the bottom of the shaver and then plugs into the wall. You get a nylon bag with it but I wasn't impressed with the bag. It's too small to fit shaver and battery so it doesn't close. I haven't had it long enough to see how many shaves I can get on one charge. It can be used wet or dry. I used it dry and was very pleased. I don't believe you would be disappointed if you purchased this shaver.

  1850. I live in UK and didn't take long to arrive.<br />I have Keratosis pilaris which is a skin condition that can make skin dry etc. Razor shaving made my skin really sore and irritating but using this shaver leavers my skin smooth and not dry.<br />Only use it dry though as this seems to make the life of the shaver last longer.<br />I first dry exfoliate then shower with aveeno shower oil,dry off then dust over with baby powder that seems to give me an extra close shave. Moisturise after, I use aveeno with shea butter. Perfect.
  1851. This product has changed my life. I have a very rare condition called aquagenic pruritus, which is essentially an allergy to water, or to water drying on the skin. When I would get out of the shower, I would experience mild itching, especially on my arms and legs for about a half hour. Shaving my legs increased the severity of this problem ten fold. I would itch so bad that my whole body would be shaking as I tried to resist scratching until I bled. It caused me extreme anxiety, so I would rarely ever shave, and could not wear shorts or dresses. I tried lotion, nair, all kinds of soaps and razors, different detergents, showering in different places, nothing worked until my boyfriend bought this for me. Being able to shave dry and not itch has lowered my anxiety significantly and now I can feel confident wearing whatever I want. If you are expecting this razor to get as close as a regular razor will, then an electric razor is not for you. No electric razor can get as close as a regular one. You will still feel a little stubble, like you might a day or so after shaving. When I use this, my legs are smooth enough that they do not feel prickly when they touch in bed. For me, this product is a lifesaver. Would buy again and again.

  1873. I'm glad I purchased this shaver, I'm one of those individuals who cannot handle nickel and other metals, and the Close Curves shaver is one of the few I can use without getting a reaction. Of course, it can't possibly shave as close as a good old fashioned razor, no electric shaver will. I have a skin condition called Keratosis Pillaris, and I can't use a wet razor, it makes my skin inflamed and I get ingrown hairs. This shaver has done fine as far as shaving my legs and underarms. I use it about every other day, and have for 2 yr. and it's still going strong. The recharger plugs into a wall outlet, if this isn't convenient for you, then you most likely won't care for it. Since it's a wet shaver it can't be charged with batteries. I've been clumsy a few times and have dropped it, but have not had any problems with performance after that happened. I do clean it out after every shave since it's loaded with my (gorilla style) leg hair. This shaver travels well too. I feel like I've gotten a good deal for at least 2 yr. usage and it doesn't give my skin a reaction. I took the advice of the first ( most popular ) reviewer here (\\"rainy\\") and have gotten great results. Thanks Rainy! If and when this shaver bites the dust, I'll probably get another one. I really doubt there would be that much difference in performance, at least for me, between this one and the next step up and I really don't need a bikini attachment. For less than $20, I'm satisfied. The shaver really does need to be fully charged to work right. If you find that it doesn't hold a charge well, I'd return it right away rather than put up with poor functioning.

  1884. Great little shaver, Light, fast, easy. Shaver is really easy to use and holds a charge for a long time. The only gripe I have is the charge time is 12 hrs!! Ridiculous.<br />But considering it holds the charge for so long it's not a big deal. Very close shave for an electric razor. Not as close as conventional razors but this also prevents irritation. Shaves the same wet or dry. Does not shave armpits well at all.<br /><br /> It's very light, love that I can just pick it up and it's easy to use and maneuver. The shaver head is completely removable they may make new blades to replace but they look like they cost more than another razor. The grip is smooth and all one piece, no rubber pads or things to catch on. Sturdy construction.<br /><br />BEWARE shaving around your bikini area, it can cause some irritation there but if you go with the hair it doesn't irritate as much. If you have longer hair, you have to clean it between strokes because the bikini adjusted head that pops out gets hair caught in it, and then the bottom blade cannot grip the hairs to cut them. But if you pop the bottom adjuster out and shake it they fall out. Relatively less noisy than most razors, but still buzzes.<br /><br />A problem I faced was my outlets in my bathroom are positioned sideways and it has to charge standing up on the charger, so having it sideways makes me think it will fall off the charger, it's very firm on the charger but I have to plug it in a standard outlet to charge it. None of my bathroom outlets point up.<br /><br />Great razor considering I have tried many others, and wax kits too.

It's a good size and feels nice to hold.<br /><br />However (and it's a big however), it just doesn't get a close shave in any way whatsoever.   1937. This shaver works much better than my last one for legs and underarms. It's not as close as a razor, but it's so quick and can be used dry. My only complaint is that there's no guard for a trim vs. a close shave for bikini area.
  1938. Definitely pleasantly surprised by this electric shaver. I have been highly disappointed in the past by both men and women's shavers. Yes, I've splurged on expensive electric razors meant for men. Some were great. Some were not-so-great. Most of the shavers meant for women were very disappointing. By far THIS is the BEST electric shaver I have purchased. It cuts close for an electric shaver, it keeps its charge for long periods of time, and it's fairly easy to clean. I haven't had to buy replacement foil razors, yet, but it seems like an easy and affordable process from what I've read online. Additionally, it's great as both a wet and dry shaver. It's affordable and it's convenient. I definitely recommend this shaver.

  1949. I bought this shaver after years of using disposable razors. I would always get irritated skin and red bumps after using disposable razors, thinking it was normal, but then found out that I had a nickel allergy, which is commonly found in disposable razors.<br /><br />So, I found this razor, and, after some research, decided it would be the right choice, based on many good reviews and it's very reasonable price. I picked one up from a Target for around 22 dollars, and was excited to get started.<br /><br />The first shave I had was perfect: I thought this machine was incredible, as it worked nearly flawlessly (not completely close like disposable ones, but that was to be expected), but it also left no irritation, and I have yet to come across a cut or even the tiniest nick from using it. I wanted to make sure it lasted a long time, so I clearly followed the simple cleaning instructions (and loved the two-sided brush it came with!)<br /><br />However, after my honeymoon period of about a month, the razor started lose its function. I would charge for the suggested 12 hours, but it would lose battery in a matter of minutes. Frustrated, but still convinced it was a good machine and the problems were my fault, I went back to Target and they gave me credit to buy another one.<br /><br />This time, I let the shaver go completely out before I charged it. I also charged it once a week, as directed. For a while, that worked, but now I've found myself back in the same predicament as before. At this point, it doesn't even turn on when I click it, unless I slide it on at least 10-12 times. Even then, the shaver doesn't stay on for more than a few minutes, and the battery runs very slowly. Today, however, I accidentally removed the outer frame while it was on and found that when I did that, the blade started running at full-speed! I was ecstatic because I thought that the problem was fixed. I put the frame back on while it was running, but it stopped again. I was stumped, so I decided that the problem had to be the foil, and went online to find another one.<br /><br />However, I decided that the 12 dollars that I might spend trying to replace the one part that may not be the answer would be better spent in another shaver. So, I have decided not to give up on Panasonic (which still seems to be acclaimed as the best), and have decided in upgrading to the more expensive ES2216PC.<br /><br />While this product worked very well when it actually did, I just can't get over the battery/outer frame issues enough to keep using it. It can be a great device, but if it's not always going to be like that, it's just not a good match for me.
  1950. It works okay. Thought it would give a closer shave. Little disappointed in how much razor stubble it leaves behind.
  1951. Best electric razor I've owned so far! It cuts closer that other electric razors.
  1952. I had a different brand wet/dry shaver that just stopped working so instead of ordering from QVC, decided to try this one. So far, I really like it. I use it mainly for dry shaving mainly of my neck/hairline so don't have a review for wet shaving. It handles well.

I've never used an electric razor in the shower, that just seems weird to me. I finally got past the weirdness and tried it wet. I'm glad I did. In the shower and with the addition of shaving cream, it's effective and close. I have very sensitive skin and find that I am much less itchy after using this in the shower with shaving cream.

  1980. Great product!! works really good but breaks easily. But it worth of its price!! Gives me pretty close shave!
  1981. It works but not that great
  1982. Works pretty well. I especially like to use it for bikini area. I would get another one. Worth the $$
  1983. Doesn't shave well at all, especially in bikini area.
  1984. No sh**, this product changed my LIFE! Of all the hundreds of purchases I have made on Amazon, this is my absolute FAVORITE!!!!!!!!!! I no longer keep any razors around, this electric shaver has replaced them FOREVER! I use this for legs, underarms, bikini area, etc.<br /><br />BOTTOM LINE: It is SO much easier and quicker than traditional shaving and just all around BETTER.<br />Razors always got me that close shave, but left me with irritated and inflamed skin 12-24 hours later. This electric shaver gets me incredibly smooth skin (ALMOST as close as a razor!!) with absolutely none of the resulting irritation. BONUS - my hair doesn't feel as &#34;prickly&#34; when it grows back like it did when I was shaving with a razor.<br /><br />A few notes on how I use this product to get the best results:<br />After a bit of experimentation, I now use this only on **completely** dry skin (aka NOT after a shower or even within 30-60 minutes after a shower). I was never really interested in trying out it's wet shaving capabilities, but when I have tried on damp skin a while after a shower, the shaver does NOT glide across the skin and is pretty much rendered useless. This is not a fault of the product of course, rather this is pretty much to be expected. Sometimes I just forget to to shave before my shower.<br />Moving on.<br />****I recommend using the trimmer first if the hair you are shaving is any longer than 2-3 mm.****<br />For legs: If my hair has grown a bit long I start out with the pop-up trimmer and glide that along my legs (if not I skip to the next step). Then I go back over the same area LIGHTLY GLIDING along my skin with the foil. THEN, if I want an extremely close shave, I go over the skin yet AGAIN but this time pressing down a bit more. Even though I go over the same areas several times with this process, it takes less than two minutes to shave my legs. For all three steps, I use the shaver AGAINST the direction of the hair growth.<br />For underarms: I *press* the foil piece across each underarm area two or three times, going in a different direction each time. Thirty seconds and they are done. Boom.<br />For bikini area: I usually only use the trimmer piece for this area and I *always* go only WITH the direction of the hair. Thirty seconds.<br /><br />Ok, why the need for the detailed directions? I recommended this product to a girl friend of a mine and she HATED it! I still can't for the life of me understand how anyone could dislike this product. She claimed it didn't work...?!?! What a shame. I didn't bother giving her the instructions I laid out here because after all, she did insult my favorite product of all time! (Joking but also serious)<br /><br />My shaver has stopped working twice since I bought it. The first time was after, instead of cleaning it with a damp rag, I dunked it under a faucet (still don't fully understand what happened). Second time was after dropping it on hard ground off a 3 foot counter. Both times I thought it was a goner for real. But instead of throwing it out right away, I let it sit for a while (not in the charging stand) and both times, 24-48 hours later, when I tried the power switch it magically turned back on like it was never ever mad at me in the first place.<br /><br />I'm just madly in love with this thing. When it does reach the end of its life, I will not hesitate to buy the exact same model again.<br /><br />Do yourself the greatest favor of all time and buy this product. Experiment with it to determine how it works best for you.

  2031. I bought this razor about 4 months ago and I'm very happy with it. It shaves closely, is easy to clean, and is rechargeable. I couldn't ask for more; it's everything that I needed it to be.<br /><br />Of the above aspects, I'm most impressed with the ease of cleaning. The entire top of the razor pops off by pushing 2 buttons on the side of the head, making it easy to get to the interior for deep cleaning. It comes with a dual-ended bristle brush for sweeping between blades and all the crevices. I found that I could even use the short bristle to sweep out the trimmer part of the razor while it's running, making for shorter interruptions during larger shave jobs.<br /><br />The charger is a small square brick that plugs into a top spot on a power outlet and the razor stands upright on top of it. I like that the charger is small enough not to block other outlet slots. Overall I'm very pleased with this razor and highly recommend it for someone looking for a decent electric razor on a thrifty budget. I'm glad I purchased this model.

When I called the warranty department, they said I had to mail the whole shaver to their MCAllen, TX, store at MY expense. A new foil is only $9.95. It would be cheaper for me to just buy a new foil. I had one of these years ago and it worked well. That's why I purchased another one. I don't care for their warranty service. I will not purchase from them again.

  2179. Why have I been using a razor all these years? This morning I said to myself that there HAD to be a better way. I then got dressed and ran to my nearest department store and purchased this exact shaver. It came with the charger which does not have a cord. Just the wall brick and the razor sits right on it, cute as can be. It comes with a two sided brush to clean the unit as well. This unit is wet/dry, meaning that you can use it in the shower. I used it dry. First apply some lubricant like baby oil to the areas you want to shave. I used my Neutrogena body oil with wonderful results. I went over the areas that I was struggling with when I was using the razor and OMG!!!!! What a miracle! One, two, three...easy peezy and no fear of nicks. Took me all of five minutes to get all smooth and clean. Seriously folks...this thing made me feel like I have been living in a cave for the last three decades. Put down that old disposable and buy this baby. You will be so happy!

I got mine September 2014, it is June 2015 and still going strong. I use shave cream, but once I run out and use soap only with no problem. I do not use dry because my skin get dry with any dry shave and even moisturizer shows it for two days (but that is just the way my skin is). Very smooth if you get the right angle (close to the blade opposite the trimmer for me). Also, I used to have the skin darkened after shaving in the bikini area and armpits, but no more.   2281. After years (and a huge expenditure of cash) of having my legs waxed, the downturn in the economy put such indulgences out of my budget. But by then, I'd been so spoiled by having my legs waxed and never having to tend to hair removal myself, that I got too lazy to use a razor once I couldn't afford the waxing. And now, with water use restrictions in California, shaving in the shower is out of the question anyway. So this electric razor is an almost perfect solution. It doesn't provide quite as close a shave as a manual razor, but then I didn't expect it to, so I'm quite satisfied. It's a breeze to use, and I haven't had any trouble with it pinching skin, as some other reviewers have reported. I've even used it on longer hair without first using the trimmer, and there wasn't any pulling or pain at all, though I would recommend following the instructions, and first using the trimmer on longer hair before shaving it closer. I've now used it on both wet and dry skin, and it works equally well on both. It initially gives a pretty close shave, but you may have to use it more often than you would a manual razor. But it's so quick and easy to use that I don't find that a problem. Love the fact that you can rinse it clean as well as use the brush if you want to clean it while dry. Have only used it three times to far, and the battery seems to be holding power well. Bottom line: a pretty decent little shaver.

  2318. Because of a review by a male customer that said this shaver was one his wife really liked, is why I bought this shaver. At that time I was trying to decide on a more expensive razor for a man.<br /><br />I am a lady who is over 60 years old and when women start to age their tissue in the face some times start to produce testosterone (or so my doctor tells me) and when this happens you grow hair on your face--especially around the chin area. This is very embarrassing for women. So this is what I needed this shaver for. Before I bought this shaver I use to have to shave my chin area at least once a week to prevent having a 5 O'clock shadow. When I first got this shaver I thought I was really going to like it because it seemed to shave my chin a lot faster than my old shaver. But alas it must not be shaving as close as my old shaver (14 years old) because now I find I am having to shave at least every other day. And because I am having to shave more often my chin is left feeling sore. I would not buy this shaver again for what I needed it for. I will probably go back to looking at those expensive shavers. It does shaves my legs OK, no problem there, and that is why I gave it 3 stars--it just does not work for my chin.

It didn't work too bad, but I was always worried about the batteries. I finally got fed up and bought this one here. I plugged it in and let it charge overnight because I wanted to make sure that it was fully powered. The first time I used it, my technique wasn't the best (pulled some hair, missed some hair, etc.) That may have been because I prefer to shave dry with electric razors... But I WILL say that the shave is really close considering its not razor blades.<br /><br />To keep it short, it's nice for a quick shave to wear shorts or a skirt, but if you're expecting someone to rub on your silky smooth legs try a regular razor.   2410. I have owned a wet/dry electric shaver for yrs. This is actually my 3rd one, the original Brand I have bought in the past is no longer available & it cost a lot more! Mind you, this one may not last as long, but unless it dies in a year I am very impressed!!<br /><br />For those who have never used a wet/dry electric razor; It's not a good idea to try to shave growth that is longer. So to have the best experience you may need to hand razor the 1st time around before you try. If you do it dry, make sure you are really really dry...not when you get out of shower dry. If you do it wet, make dang sure you use soap or shaving cream, not just water. If you do these things you will have a convenient little gadget you can use on the fly without big productions! Obviously the wet method will shave closer, but most of the time the dry works just fine!!

I have been using disposable razors for several years now only because my previous electric razor died and at the time I was unable to find a suitable replacement. It always seemed to me that the focus was on men's razors and the ladies were left with few good options. I didn't mind spending the money on a razor, but could not really find what I wanted. I finally broke down and began to look at electric razors again since I was cutting my legs up terribly no matter how careful I was trying to be and no matter what type of disposable or cream/gel I was using. I again did not see that much in the ladies' market (as compared to the options available for men and aside from the new crop of epilators that I was not ready to try). Then I came across this razor and saw that there were several models ranging in price from this $16 and change up to $60ish or so. I was contemplating which model to get but then decided to give the least expensive one a try since it had gotten so many good reviews. I have been using this razor for several months now and I am surprisingly more than satisfied. For the good points, it appears well made, is easy to hold, and does a very good job with no nicks or cuts! I can't say it is exactly as close as a blade shave, but if you keep up with regular shaving, it is certainly very, very good and better than being cut up. The bikini area trimmer that pops up also works very well. It was compact enough to take on vacation with the little charger. Although this is a wet/dry shaver, I have only used it dry so that it is what I am reviewing. The only negative is that it is recommend to charge for 12 hours. I really would like to have a much shorter charging time, but it does hold a charge through quite a number of shaves and I try to be mindful about charging it so that I have it ready when I need it. It would be great if it also came with a base type charger and a better case for travel (comes with a very thin drawstring bag and small cleaning brush), but for 16 bucks, it is well worth the price. I waited several months to do my review and so far so good!
  2421. good if you have irritation with the razor, for me does not last suffiencient enough for my both legs, wish it could last longer or have the corded option. I have a silkepil braun but the razor attachment sucks
  2422. Love this shaver. Gives a close shave, and can be used on longer hair too. Other shavers won't work on longer hair and must be used only on short stubble. I don't shave as often as I should in winter so my hair gets longer. This beauty takes care of the hair with no problems. Highly recommend this shaver. It holds a charge for a long time too. No need to keep it plugged in 24/7.

The shaver does not do a close shave like a razor would do.<br /><br />However, I avoid the general nicks that I would get with a razor.

  2432. This little razor can get the worst of the hair off, but if you have fast-growing hair (like me), you'll be stubbly again by the end of the day. That being said, it does a good enough job that I'm not afraid of going sleeveless. It gets me smooth enough for everyday, just not smooth enough for date night. If somebody's going to be super-close (or touching) you'll want something better.<br /><br />I like the pop-up trimmer to keep downstairs neat and tidy, but you'll definitely want to make sure this is fully charged before attempting it. The trimmer does cut things pretty close -- closer than I would have chosen, but it keeps the hair long enough that ingrowns aren't an issue.

This would be a much better product if it had an optional electric cord so it didn't run out of power half way through a shave (presently it is only powered by wall charge and a full re-charge can take up to 8 hours).
  2441. I had great luck with this little razor. I've had it for almost two months now, and had no loss of power or dulling of blades.<br /><br />I love that there is no long cord to the charger. It just plugs into the wall, and the razor just sits right on top of the charger. Very economical use of space.<br /><br />I read other reviews that mentioned tugging and ripping hair out, so I was nervous, but I have had NONE of that. I read and followed the instructions, which were short and to the point. Whether that made a difference, I don't know, but the results were as expected and better.<br /><br />The trimmer works well, but cuts pretty short.<br /><br />I had no problems using this razor for underarms, legs, or bikini area.<br /><br />This razor met and exceeded my expectations, and I would (and have) definitely recommend to others.
  2442. What a powerful unit and a clean shave. Only problem is there is not a base with a cord. It must be placed into an outlet so if you have a limited amount of these in your house it may present a problem. It does hold a charge for a good amount of time.

  2453. This shaver, which has one cutter, (dissappointed,) shaves slightly above average. I give it a 7.5 out of 10 for closeness. I use it on my skull. :) . It will last, however, because of the thicker foil.<br /><br />HOW TO MAKE A BATTERY LAST: To avoid getting a bad case of battery memory, (look it up,) run the shaver down, and then charge it for 18 or more hrs. The directions say 12. I only got about 4 shave from a 12 hr. charge. I get about 7 from a long long charge. The ddirections do say to secure the shaver to the stand after use; but what they mean, but don't say, is when the charger is unplugged. Recharging too much, or when there is a lot of charge left, will lower battery longevity seriously, (especially with nickel batteries.)<br /><br />I was able to get this shipped to north of the 49th parallel, (Canada,) but the shipping cost = owwww!!! A customs fee charged is not necessary for an item of this price.
  2454. VERY NICE SHAVER. CHARGES VERY EASILY. EASY TO USE. NATURALLY IT DOES NOT SHAVE AS CLOSE AS A REGULAR RAZOR...BUT FASTER.

  2483. I used electric in the past, but back then no matter how much money I threw at it, I always had issues with stubble and hair catching (I have very thick and coarse stands which can be hell on any kind of blade... And sensitive skin, which just makes it worse). I decided to go back to electric during my last pregnancy so I wouldn't have to be hairy in the final stages, and at first I was using cheapo $10 electrics because honestly I didn't see much of a difference between them and the note expensive ones I used in the past, plus at $10 a pop I could just toss them when the blades wore out. But recently I couldn't find those so I ebbed up getting this since it was the next cheapest. WOW. This is hands down the best electric I've used to date. It really works well on my hair and skin type. The shave is close to manual razor quality, and it glides like butter even when I use it on my armpits, dry. I've never had a more comfortable shave. Even the trimmer, which normally hurts more than the blades on other electrics if you're not careful enough with it, doesn't pinch, pull, or even scrape.<br /><br />It's got sturdy construction and a nice contoured, heavy feel in hand. The foil and blade seem to be top notch and not likely to go dull quickly. I anticipate it may get slippery in the shower due to lack of rubberized grip and mostly flat switches, but I don't use these in the shower anyway. The clear protective cap fits snugly and doesn't wiggle or come off on its own. One charge lasts several shaves before losing full power.<br /><br />It comes with a small brush, protective cap for the head, charger, and a small travel pouch, which it and all the accessories fit into easily and nicely. The pouch is also handy for hanging it to dry after cleaning.

  2536. I love this shaver! I used it to remove underarm hair and I no longer get painful razor bumps and ingrown hairs in my arm pits like i did when using a disposable razor (venus). I have very thick leg hair and this took care of it with no problems, and I had none of the itchiness that affected me with the use of disposable razors (venus!). I also used it on my bikini area without fear of pinching or discomfort. It'll mow through your jungle with no problems. While the shave this unit gives isn't as close as a disposable razor, it still left my underarms and legs very smooth. Not to mention, the darkness and discoloration that my armpits suffered from the constant trauma of razor burn has gone away! The idea of going back to a disposable razor pains me greatly.<br /><br />I've noticed that many reviews for this item mention the shaver dying after 8 months or so. I've had this shaver since January of 2012 and as of now it has not died on me. However, after 10 months of moderate use the blades have become incredibly dull. When I realized the blades were failing I was only going to replace the blades rather than the entire unit, but I decided against that because 1: the replacement head is nearly as expensive as the shaver itself and 2: from what I can see from the pictures of the replacement blades, it only includes the foil and not the pop up trimmer. Over the last 10 months the pop up trimmer blades have become so dull that they no longer remove hair effectively. The foil still works great, so a replacement foil wouldn't help me at all.<br /><br />With that said, I still believe this shaver is very good for the price. Good enough that I've repurchased this exact same shaver knowing that it will become dull within a year and I'll have to replace it again. Disappointing, but honestly, since I purchased this for nearly half off of Amazon's listed price I'm not going to complain.
  2537. Great razor! Had another brand that was constantly needing new screens and foils. Not true with this one. Charges on the wall.

  2539. This is the first time I purchased a Panasonic electric razor. This razor is lightweight and there is no cord from the chargeable base to the outlet to worry about.   2558. This works so good. Had I known how well this worked , I would have bought this a long time ago.
  2559. This product gives a close shave but not as close as a traditional razor. But that doesn't bother me. I end up having to shave ever other day since my hair grows rather fast. I haven't shaved my legs with it but I only use it on my underarms. It works really well I have to say. The charging time of 12 hours is a bit much, but it seems to last a long time between charging times. But really, how long does it take to shave your underarms.. Like 30 seconds each? So that's probably why.<br /><br />I absolutely HATE the charger. For the average person who has a medicine cabinet over the wall outlet, this just doesn't work. The shaver sits directly on top of the little square charger which plugs into the outlet. So I can't use the top outlet (of the two) because the plug will not plug into the outlet due to the shaver hitting the medicine cabinet up there. I had to unplug my electric toothbrush cord so that I could use the shaver plug in the bottom plug, meaning nothing else can be plugged in while I am charging the shaver. I would much rather have a cord to contend with than that stupid square charger.<br /><br />But other than the shaver charger, the shaver itself is great! It is difficult to clean out the trimmer heads (one on front, one on back) but since I don't use them I guess I don't have to worry about them. Cleaning the blades is easy with the included brush. I think the shorter stubby brush is for the blades and the long more easily bendable brush is for the inside of the foil. I wouldn't use the stiff bristles on the foil since foils are easily torn.<br /><br />The shaver isn't as loud as I expected it to be. I'm pleasantly surprised. It's less loud than my Wahl hair clippers.<br /><br />I will have to buy lubricating oil for it since it didn't come with any, which I find odd. But then again these were rather inexpensive.<br /><br />The travel bag that comes with it is really cheap and gross so I tossed it.<br /><br />So all in all I really like this shaver. I hope it lasts for years to come, as long as Panasonic keeps making the replacement foils and blades...hope it lasts for years to come, as long as Panasonic keeps making the replacement foils and blades...

  2563. I've used this shaver a couple times now and so far I'm quite pleased with it. I'm not a big fan of shaving my legs because my skin is very dry and sensitive so it's prone to razor burn and bumps when using regular blades. I don't know why I haven't tried an electric razor before. This razor is so comfortable to use, quick and convenient. I've been using it on dry skin because without the water running, I can wear my glasses/contacts so I can see what I'm doing. It's nice to know that it does work in the water as well. I would definitely not label this as a close shave razor, but where it lacks in closeness, it makes up in comfort, ease of use, speed, and convenience. It doesn't matter too much since I'm in my thirties and my hair doesn't grow like it did in my teens. Another plus is that it comes with a charger so you don't have to worry about batteries. I recommend this for anyone who wants a convenient, comfortable shave and wants the look of smooth legs without the hassle and irritation of normal blades. I would say if you're in a situation where you need a really smooth shave (honeymoon, beach vacation etc.) stick with the razor but bring this along for touch-ups!
